DataElement.preferredName: Bleeding Diathesis Personal Medical History Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a person to participate in a clinical study that are related to the medical history of bleeding diathesis as outlined in the protocol.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have a history o
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of bleeding diathesis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex -  1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have evidence or history of bleeding diathesis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had clinically significant hematuria, hematemesis, or hemoptysis or other history of significant bleeding (e.g., pulmonary hemorrhage) within 12 weeks before first dose?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have bleeding diathesis that requires anticoagulants or antiplatelet agents including nonsteroidal anti inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) at the time of the scheduled resection that cannot be stopped for surgery

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of known bleeding disorders or history of clinically significant hemorrhage (e.g. GI, neurologic) within the past 6 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any of the following within 12 weeks prior to the randomization gastrointestinal bleeding, hemoptysis or pulmonary hemorrhage, radiographic evidence of cavitating pulmonary lesion(s), evidence of tumor invasion of the GI tract (esophagus, stomach, small or large bowel, rectum, or anus), or any evidence of endotracheal or endobronchial tumor or encasement of any major blood vessels?
